alert.note: Alert for St. Lawrence (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 25 at 5:43PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 530 AM EST MONDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam is occurring. * WHERE...A portion of northern New York, including the following county, St. Lawrence. * WHEN...Until 530 AM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Depending on ice behavior, any release of the ice jam could result in sudden rises of water, leading to a rapid flooding situation. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 539 PM EST, emergency management reported continued flooding from an ice jam on the Raquette River in the town of Pierrepont. Houses on and near Alexander Drive continue to be impacted. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Colton. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Ice jams are unpredictable, and rapid fluctuations in water levels are possible. Please obey all road closures and instructions from local authorities. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
